Header file iostream_support.hpp

#include "error.hpp"

namespace system_error2
{
    template <class DomainType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_same<std::ostream, typename std::decay<decltype(std::declval<std::ostream>() << std::declval<typename status_code<DomainType>::value_type>())>::type>::value, bool>::type = true>
    std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, status_code<DomainType> const& v);

    template <class ErasedType>
    std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, status_code<erased<ErasedType>> const& v);

    std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, system_error2::generic_code const& v);
}

Function system_error2::operator<<

template <class DomainType, typename std::enable_if<std::is_same<std::ostream, typename std::decay<decltype(std::declval<std::ostream>() << std::declval<typename status_code<DomainType>::value_type>())>::type>::value, bool>::type = true>
std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, status_code<DomainType> const& v);

Print the status code to a std::ostream &.

Requires that DomainType::value_type implements an operator<< overload for std::ostream.

Function system_error2::operator<<

template <class ErasedType>
std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, status_code<erased<ErasedType>> const& v);

Print the erased status code to a std::ostream &.

Function system_error2::operator<<

std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& s, system_error2::generic_code const& v);

Print the generic code to a std::ostream &.
